Title: Adding feature flags to an ASP.NET Core app
Description: This post is about Adding feature flags to an ASP.NET Core app.Feature flags (also known as feature toggles or feature switches) are a software development technique that turns certain functionality on and off during runtime, without deploying new code. In this post we will discuss about flags using appsettings.json file. I am using an ASP.NET Core MVC project, you can do it for any .NET Core project like Razor Web Apps, or Web APIs.

Title: Introduction to Unit Testing With NUnit in C# - Code Maze
Description: In this article, we are going to talk about the NUnit testing framework that we can use to write tests in our C# applications.

Title: 296: NSUrl, Security Scope, & Bookmarks
Description: Who doesn't love security? Who doesn't love security inside of the app sandbox?!?! We break down file-access and all of its complexity when building sandboxed apps for iOS, macOS, Android, and Windows!

Title: C++ Cheat Sheets & Infographics

Title: Steps we've taken around Cloudflare's services in Ukraine, Belarus, and Russia

Title: Microsoft DDoS protection response guide
Description: Receiving Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attack threats? This guide provides an overview of what Microsoft provides at the platform level, information on recent mitigations, and best practices.

Title: Windows Package Manager 1.2
Description: We’ve been busy improving the Windows Package Manager. Today I have the pleasure of announcing the availability of Windows Package Manager 1.2. It has been released to the Microsoft Store as an automatic update to the “App Installer” this morning if you’re running Windows 10 (1809+) or Windows 11.

Title: PowerShell and OpenSSH team investments for 2022
Description: It’s time to discuss the team investments for 2022. For some areas we’ll be completing work we’ve already started, and in others we’ll be beginning on new projects. Executive Order on Cybersecurity One of the areas we’ve already spent significant effort on is adhering to the Executive Order on Cybersecurity.

Title: Building a generate routes function using Terraform test
Description:
Welcome to the next episode of thinking out loud to route in the cloud with style.
Earlier this season we abstracted a TGW Centralized Router.
Part of it’s responsibility is to manage routes between Tiered VPCs within a single region.
Looking forward, it would be nice to route between many TGW Centralized Routers but cross region with some kind of TGW Super Router abstraction.
